website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive version of a soil-less, gel ant farm that delights both viewers and ants.
pros: A great deal for an ant farm
Ants adjust well to this habitat and tunnel happily and within hours of assembly
cons: Smaller than expected but can be connected to other ant farms

customer_reviews.title: **ANT KILLER ALERT**
customer_reviews.text: Why bother with insecticide to kill your ant problem? Just put them in here! EVERY ant I put in this died. THIS GEL, is not nourishing, hydrating or tunneling safe. I keep actual Queen founded colonies but was curious about the killer gel design I keep hearing nightmare stories about. And it true! I used ant traps to catch a few different species of feral ants(not at the same time) from my backyard and every species died! DUMP THE DEADLY GEL and you can fill it with a good natural ant friendly substrate and then it’s ok, not great but OK for small to medium size ant species (not for harvester or carpenter ants).
customer_reviews.author: Irene Luna portis

customer_reviews.title: great for the price. My 3 y.o. Loves it
customer_reviews.text: This product had very mixed reviews. I however found it to be great for the price. The ants I ordered separately love it! The picture below is two days worth of work, they seem to love their home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't Subject Ants to This Cruelty
customer_reviews.text: This is TINY. Look elsewhere for a better product at a better price. ALSO seller requires you to pay for return shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: best deal as well as so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: best deal as well as so easy to use. Ants have stayed alive for months so far. you do need a tiny thread or string to go down the tube for ants to have access to the top.
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of the nicer LED farms and the ants didn't dig and seemed very unhappy. I bought one of these ant castles and used ants from the same colony. It wasn't even a day before they were adjusted and digging intricate tunnels. Much better deal and I am a lot happier with the product. So far I have ordered three of them and just buy the blue replacement gels so we can keep Farms from all the different colonies of red ants we have on our lands.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E. Dimock

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Came in broken box, ants ESCAPED from it after we put them in there!!!!! I started a return and that never went through. didn't get my money back left with a USELESS item and no money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: Argentine ants will squeeze out of the vents
customer_reviews.text: Tried capturing Argentine ants (the common black ones) for my office (I work pest control) and they were small enough to escape through the vent holes. Ended up cutting some wood to fit inside and put termites inside instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Cute little ant house for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Got this ant farm for my 9 year old son and he loves it! It’s a cute, small, but secure ant 🐜 trap and I like the way this company set their ant houses up and explained in a how to paper to the kids, how to care for the ants, feed them & how to give them water. It’s smaller than I thought it’d be, kinda pricy, but it’s worth it bc I know my son will get a lot of use outta this having fun catching and watching & taking care of his new ant pets. Would recommend buying this , helps pass the time & can have fun doing it!
customer_reviews.author: Buy local, buy your grow stuff from US

customer_reviews.title: I will buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a birthday present for a 9 year old who has taken an interest in ants. Wasn’t sure I would like the “gel” but went with it anyway. So glad I did. Makes it so easy to watch and follow and keeps the ants nourished. Well made- no “escapes” yet and everyone working together. Birthday boy loved it and most likely will purchase another one- not for him but for his grandmother!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: After a hiccup, an amazing experience with this product
customer_reviews.text: Our ant farm arrived with cracked gel from freezing while at the warehouse, but we temporarily housed our ants in it out of necessity. The company was AMAZING and responsive and immediately sent a replacement at no charge to us, and we have been very happy with both their service and their product. This is a good investment and a new ant farm enthusiast will find much enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Ashe

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery...nice product
customer_reviews.text: Nice little ant farm. Quick shipping! We added red tape to ensure none of the stinging ants escape via our 3 year-old!!
customer_reviews.author: Alora

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The ants get trapped at the bottom and arent able to get back up the tube and die. Just go with the basic sand ant farm if you are looking for good results. Those always worked best for me. These gel ones suck
customer_reviews.author: Nkeller1987

customer_reviews.title: Has breather holes big enough for ants to escape
customer_reviews.text: Terrible ant castle. Got ants to go in, few hours later not a single ant inside, they escaped throught the built in breather hole which for some reason ants can fit through.
customer_reviews.author: Esme

customer_reviews.title: Grandson LOVES his ant farms!!
customer_reviews.text: This is much smaller than anticipated, and no, I didn't read the description. The ants seemed to have a problem getting up INTO the feeding area, so we stuck a small piece of straw into the hole, so they could climb up and into the food area. Unfortunately, the ants seem to bury their dead under the feeding area, which doesn't appear to be accessible by us, to clean it out.
customer_reviews.author: Becca Currie

customer_reviews.title: Decent farm
customer_reviews.text: Likes - Ants stay in it Ants dig tunnels Small footprint Dislikes - Impossible to clean Our dead ants/food without ants getting out. Nifty contraption we got to help our toddler overcome her bug fear. It takes a few days for the ant to make it up the tube to the gel but once they do, they’re pretty nifty to watch. So far, no escapees
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Great set-up
customer_reviews.text: The ant farm has a separate section for food, water, and waste. We've had other ant farms before and they didnt have this feature and got moldy. This one should be much easier to keep clean. The ants we purchased (separately) are very active and seem to like their new home.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay B.

customer_reviews.title: Ants fit through air holes.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this product! The ant farm itself is made very nicely, but the air holes are big enough for ant to crawl right out of. We filled it with 15+ ants one night only to find them almost all gone the next morning and actually witnessed 2 of them in the act. Maybe if you order the ants on Amazon, they will be bigger than the ants from our sandbox area?
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Good gel, good construction. Ants love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very good! A bit smaller than I expected, but they tell you the dimensions, so I must have just been overly optimistic. But you get exactly what they say you will get. Good quality gel, my nephews ants love it and are still all alive, tunneling away months later. Good clarity. Really can’t ask for more in an ant farm. I didn’t see the point of the “nest” box, but the ants love it so what do I know?
customer_reviews.author: Jovin Weinstock

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The ants died two days after getting them and the blue stuff molded
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Meador

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: Ants wouldn't eat this or tunnel at all. The gel wasn't even filling up the space because it doesn't fit. 2 batches of ants and none started a tunnel. Terrible
customer_reviews.author: Christian Vanscoyk

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product.
customer_reviews.text: The castle was perfect. Everything was in place and my ants never went out of this fort. The only thing is that it looks bigger than it actually is. It was very useful for me, it even traveled on my car, and the ants were happy I guess. It was delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: PsicoJ

customer_reviews.title: 4 months later and still going
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas and purchase some ants (from a separate website) for delivery. Its been four months and we still have about 5 or 6 ants going strong. Its been a lot of fun watching these ants dig.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs tweaks..
customer_reviews.text: I was fine with the size and everything, but there are two problems I seem to crossover.There is a small tunnel that is supposed to be the watering hole i think and it seems to drown a lot of my ants.The other problem is the tube that leads to the gel is too tall out of the gel so my ant have trouble climbing up and back in.Overall I think it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Derby Girl

customer_reviews.title: Keep
customer_reviews.text: We threw it out after a few weeks. The ants did not dig tunnels, the food got moldy in the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O.

customer_reviews.title: Thanks
customer_reviews.text: The gel is seaweed. Ignore that conspiracy of it being lethal. 1 months later, the ants we purchased are thriving off the gel.
customer_reviews.author: Lightning

customer_reviews.title: Its an ant farm!
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern is that the ants cannot escape. So far, so good. They've tried, but the walls have held them all in. Kids love watching the ants work. We picked up some harvester ants and they tunnel like crazy. Great purchase if you want a small ant farm.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stiemsma

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating to watch!
customer_reviews.text: Our 6yo loves it! To be honest, at first all I could think was yuck, we paid money to keep the ants out and now we’re paying to bring them in?! 🤔. But they are fascinating to watch and no escapees! The pictures are about 3 days after the ants were put into the farm. Took one star off for giftable - the ants are a separate order, which makes total sense but would be hard if you are gifting and the kiddo wants to see the ants in action right away.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: My husband was so giddy
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for himself and the ants lasted way longer than expected. They made their little tunnels and you would think my husband was a 10 year old kid again. Anyone who enjoys this kind of stuff would love this as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren H

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Very cool design. Kids love it.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. Easy to use. Was a little concerned about the seals so used clear tape. (Left air holes open)
customer_reviews.author: Jmcnulty

customer_reviews.title: Kids that enjoy hands on science projects will love the ant castle
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son is currently obsessed with ants ! The ant habitat is awesome - we out a little candy in it and the ants came to the castle super fun to watch - and the gel tunnels are impressive to see! The package arrived neatly packed and well protected - greet value for your money for kids interested in science and how ants work together !
customer_reviews.author: JMAR

customer_reviews.title: Small!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very very tiny!!! Lol. Read product dimensions before you purchase..... supa small..... like an ant apartment. Or ant bathroom.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It's a brand new item but missing a plastic plug. without the plug ant will escape.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Everything works like it should. Easy way to add water and food. Very easy to see what the ants are doing. Buy it!

customer_reviews.title: With the costs of ants with shipping I would not recommend this. We wanted to use this in our ...
customer_reviews.text: The ants have died and don't seem to thrive in this system at all. The kids of course lost interest in it with only one alive for a week or so. With the costs of ants with shipping I would not recommend this. We wanted to use this in our preschool program.

customer_reviews.title: Half of the ants were dead upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a gift for our 9-year-old-grandson, and he eagerly awaited it. Half of the ants were dead upon arrival. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: carsim

customer_reviews.title: So fun! Great quality
customer_reviews.text: My son loves looking at the ants build ! Great product and lots of fun ! Great quality and worth the money!

customer_reviews.title: connected well
customer_reviews.text: Great and connected well with the other smaller ant nursery farms.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. The entire family has enjoyed this
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. The entire family has enjoyed this. Only negative is it is very hard to get the ants in the container without a few escaping.
customer_reviews.author: fathers day gift

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: The design and make are very interesting. Definitely kid friendly use wise. It is plastic so it'll have to be placed strategically of you have a wild child. Durability is why the 4

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cool
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected. Pretty cool though. Dislike the fact I can't open up the little feeder section all the way since this is where the ants decided to put their dead. I have no way of removing them from the container.

customer_reviews.title: Educational and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: My ant farm was great and the ants lived for 20+ weeks . Lots of tunnel action !
customer_reviews.author: Tonya B.

customer_reviews.title: Reputable company & fun
customer_reviews.text: When product first arrived, it was missing a small piece but still useable. I contacted them & they more than made it right. Our ants love it. Tomorrow we shall find more as only started with 6 ants, can hold more. 5 star company.

customer_reviews.text: Love this ant farm!! So cool, so easy and well designed. My 3 year old son is mesmerized by it.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Nephew/Awesome Aunt
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew for Christmas because that's what he wanted. Strange I know but he's unique. It was exactly what I thought it would be. I will have a happy nephew come Christmas morning.

customer_reviews.text: Its a little smaller than I imagined, but that wasn't the issue for me. I did not receive the tube or yellow cotton pad that it said was in the package. The cotton I can get around, but the test tubes I already have don't fit in the hole for the product, so capturing and transferring a queen is a problem.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: MUCH smaller than we imagined. It's slightly taller than our baby monitor and smaller than a book in actual size. It is fun to look at! The kids enjoyed it and had lots of fun. The ants didn't seem to have enough room to "pile" the blue/white stuff up as they dug it out of the tunnels, not sure if that is normal though. Our ants lasted for a few months before dying off. We added food to it, which the ants really seemed to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool Gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is a unique style of Ant Farm. It gives parents an opportunity to really talk about science with their kids. Instead of ordering ants in the mail, this system allows the observer to collect ants naturally in their own yard/environment. Much more to see and learn with this ant nursery.

customer_reviews.title: Itty bitty

product_meta.title: NAVADEAL Ant Farm Castle, Habitat Educational & Learning Science Kit Toy for Kids - Allows Study of The Behavior of Ants and Social Structure, Ecosystem Within The 3D Maze of Translucent Gel
feature_bullets: A SPECTACULAR HABITAT FOR ANTS- A great science habitat for kids to watch ants create 3D tunnels and society, there also have feeding system and ant nursery, so kids can watch ants nurture their young, how amazing it will be to observe! Our unique ant castle also has aperture designed on the lid of the feeding system makes easier for loading ants into the container and more convenience of ventilation. Usually 15-20 ants for keeping.

BLUE GEL WITH NUTRITION- translucent gel offers a new and Unique Perspective from that of soil-based habitats. Meanwhile, the feeding and watering holes make the ant farm more interactive than others. Surely this ant farm will be a great Christmas gift idea for kids and also for those adults who is interesting in explore the nature.
PACKAGE INCLUDES: Ant Farm with gel pre-filled x1, plastic pipette x1, nipper x1, cotton pad x2, manual x1. Product Size: 4 1/4" L * 4 1/4"W * 4"H.

ATTENTION- Live ants are not included. You could buy ants from trustworthy sources or order online, there is “live ants order recommendation card” inside the package and also include a COUPON for buying live ants, pls make sure you will carefully check if the ants arrive alive, we suggest harvester ants or carpenter ants and over ¼ long.

STEM.ORG AUTHENTICATED & 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - This ant farm has been authenticated to meet the STEM.org highest quality standards and NAVAdeal are backed by 100% guarantee that you are fully satisfied with our ant farm or receive your money back.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars538 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
